references.reason: This paper is one of the foundational works on concept erasure in diffusion models and is cited frequently as a baseline and for comparison.

references.paper_title: MACE: Mass concept erasure in diffusion models
references.reason: MACE is heavily referenced because the current paper extends it's functionality, delivers better performance than it and uses it in comparisons.

references.paper_title: Safe latent diffusion: Mitigating inappropriate degeneration in diffusion models
references.reason: This paper is important because it is used as a baseline for comparison in the task of removing NSFW content.
Classifier-free diffusion guidance (CFG) is foundational to the field and is important for guiding the image generation process, thus being referenced when referring to its use.

references.paper_title: Ablating concepts in text-to-image diffusion models
references.reason: This paper presents a finetuning framework that aligns the score function of an unwanted concept with that of an anchor concept, delivering an alternative strategy for concept ablation, and is a frequently used baseline.
